data.title: Much better than I expected
data.text: Quite a selection of artists and different styles.  We loved the upstairs world income art.  Puts things into perspective.  Best of all, it is free.

data.title: Mix of Art and Culture
data.text: The Polk Museum of Art offers a great collection of art exhibits, as well as exhibits that document American culture. The staff is very friendly and the building is well kept. I thoroughly enjoyed walking through this beautiful museum.

data.title: Great local musuem
data.text: I love coming here, as a local I love to see the local art that they have on display. It may be small but there is plenty here for everyone to see.

data.title: beauteous!
data.text: Always finding new and local work here! It's great that it's free to go and they also support our local art teachers A LOT!

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: Came here with the family for an art festival and it was fantastic. This is definitely not just a one note kind of museum. There were many different styles of art and kept our little guys interested.

data.title: Passing through town
data.text: I was in town from Phoenix, AZ for my college reunion, so I came by on a Sunday. Free admission, they accept donations, staff were very cordial and the art on display was for me, very interesting. Worth you time for sure.

data.title: Always interesting shows at this free museum
data.text: We are never disappointed when visting.  Provocative, interesting art work.  Large galleries, outdoor sculpture garden, free parking.

data.title: Small but nice
data.text: It took us about an hour or so to your the two story museum. Loved the Marylin Monroe gold displays and what people eat in other countries comparison  display. Intresting and worth walking through and reading in its entirety. Did not care for the others as to me it was just rubish art my 7 year old nice can do. Staff was nice and helpful. Bathrooms were clean.

data.title: I'm always impressed with this local museum
data.text: This is a lovely small art museum.  Although they always have specific exhibits our favorite part of our visit is the art of the local students. There is always an outstanding exhibit of student art.  Also their museum shop is the best, bar none.

data.title: Maybe on Another Occasion
data.text: When we visited the Polk Museum, the main shows in the gallery were not especially interesting to us, so this meant we were not inclined to stay very long. This is not a criticism of the Polk Museum; it just happened that what they were showing was either of little interest to us, or we had seen better showings on the same theme in other art museums. Just the luck of the draw. The museum itself is attractive, modern and seems top be well run and well attended.

data.title: Well curated small art museum
data.text: If you appreciate art, make sure to go to this art museum if you are in Lakeland. We really enjoyed the variety of artwork and the beautiful space to view it. It's convenient from downtown and just adjacent to the lovely public library. Even an hour or so is enough to see most, if not all, of the works on display.

data.title: So much to like about this museum
data.text: I have been visiting this museum since it was housed in an old supermarket building.  It is the place where I discovered Ansel Adams' photos, Rauschenberg's collage paintings and Calder's mobiles.  As for size it's small considering the size of some of the exhibits they manage to install.  Summer art programs for children are a plus too.  I am proud to support this museum.

data.title: Pleasant afternoon visit
data.text: I had been wanting to visit this museum for a few years and we finally set aside an afternoon to do it.  An hour or two is all you need and it is well worth your time.  Hard to believe that it is also free!  The variety of exhibits was very nice, pre-Colombian artifacts, paintings, a moon art exhibit along with several other small collections.  One current exhibit on the second floor was very interesting.  Titled Material World and The Hungry Planet, it consists of photographs of families from several countries with all their belongings and information about their living conditions.  Gives you a chance to pause and reflect on your own situation.  Also, don't miss the gift shop which is loaded with great items at reasonable prices.

data.title: good local museum
data.text: It is a small good museum in the downtown, may not have greatest of collections but still since it is free it is worth going.

data.title: Worth the time
data.text: They have rotating exhibits throughout the year geared to different age levels. We took our grandsons to a skateboard art exhibit. It was fascinating. They have a wonderful museum store as well.

data.title: A great find!
data.text: It was looking like it was about to rain today while we fed the swans and we hightailed it to the library to chill and hang out. We saw a sign that the museum was free and took advantage of the facility while it poured outside. It was a delightful little find with art from South America, a very cool photo exhibit, and art from local schools. We loved the skateboards that the 8th graders painted. Thank you for making this free and giving us a lovely afternoon while it rained outside!

data.title: Great museum for its size, and now free
data.text:
I love the Polk Museum of Art, and now thanks to the generosity of its patrons, it is now free.  Hopefully more people will take advantage of it.  

They rotate shows every few months; this time it was African American art with a number of them dealing with civil rights.  Many of the paintings were done before or in the early stage of the civil rights movement, at least from this honkeys perspective.  I mean by this that the civil rights movement began 100 years before the March on Washington.  

The art displayed was excellent and we really enjoyed the hour or so we spent looking at each piece.  I would like to go back soon as I think the second time will result in new insights into this important period in American history.

Another thing I love about the museum is that it is more than just a museum.  It is also a "school" where children from the area take classes, and as such promotes the arts among the young.  They also feature the best youth art in the county in a special room.  

PMA is a class act.

data.title: Now has free admission!
data.text: This museum is smaller than some I have been to but does offer a fair amount to look at.  I have brought my children here and they have enjoyed seeing the different elements of art.  The best part about it now is that it is FREE!

data.title: Nice little art museum
data.text: There are different exhibits at different times, but they don;t really seem to be utilizing this space to it's full potential.  They could easily triple or quadruple what is displayed here. Still, worth checking out if you are here on one of the many free admission days.  Nice little gift shop.

data.title: NIce County Art Museum
data.text: First, Friday is FREE DAY. This small museum should be noted mostly for its pre-Columbian artifacts, which are displayed right off the lobby. Very impressive. The museum also has two large galleries that display rotating works of artists. The small upstairs houses a couple hallways with displays off of the museum offices.
